NISSAN MOTOR CO., Japan, said it would sell part of its equity stake in the Japanese auto parts maker Yorozu Corp. to Minneapolis-based Tower Automotive Inc. for an undisclosed amount. Nissan added that Tower would replace Nissan as Yorozu's top shareholder in acquiring a 17 percent stake.

BURNHAM PACIFIC PROPERTIES INC., San Diego, one of the largest owners of strip malls on the West Coast, agreed to sell 19 shopping centers in California to the closely held GMS Realty L.L.C., based in Carlsbad, Calif., for $305 million in cash. The sale is part of Burnham's announced liquidation plan.

LUFTHANSA TECHNIK A.G., Hamburg, Germany, the technical and maintenance arm of the German airline Lufthansa and the world's largest provider of aviation repair and overhaul services, said it had acquired a controlling stake in Hawker Pacific Aerospace, a landing-gear maintenance services company based in Sun Valley, Calif. Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.

TRIBUNE CO., Chicago, the No. 3 U.S. newspaper publisher and owner of numerous radio and television stations, plans to spend more than $100 million to expand its Chicago Tribune distribution and printing operation. Plans are to expand the 700,000-square-foot Freedom Center by more than 120,000 square feet to add storage, packaging and distribution capacity. In the second phase of the project, a 115,000-square-foot building will be built opposite the 20-year-old plant to package the Tribune's Sunday editions.
